diseases.name: Influenza
diseases.introduction: Influenza, or the flu, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
diseases.causes: Caused by influenza viruses, spread through respiratory droplets.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical exam, rapid influenza diagnostic test (RIDT), and PCR tests.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications (oseltamivir), rest, hydration.
diseases.prevention: Annual flu vaccination, hand hygiene, avoiding contact with infected people.

diseases.name: Mpox
diseases.introduction: Mpox is a viral zoonotic disease caused by the monkeypox virus, characterized by a rash and flu-like symptoms. It is related to the virus that causes smallpox.
symptoms: Rash that progresses from macules to papules, vesicles, pustules, and scabs
diseases.causes: Caused by the monkeypox virus, transmitted through close contact with an infected person or animal, or with material contaminated with the virus.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical evaluation of symptoms; laboratory testing of samples from lesions for viral DNA.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care to relieve symptoms; antiviral drugs licensed for smallpox, such as tecovirimat, may be effective.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination with vaccines developed for smallpox; avoiding close contact with infected individuals; practicing good hygiene.

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.introduction: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.
diseases.causes: Caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, spread through the air.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, sputum test, tuberculin skin test.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as isoniazid and rifampin for 6 months or more.
diseases.prevention: BCG vaccine, early detection and treatment.

diseases.name: COVID-19
diseases.introduction: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
diseases.causes: Caused by SARS-CoV-2, transmitted via respiratory droplets.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR test, antigen test.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, antiviral medications (remdesivir), oxygen therapy if needed.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, mask-wearing, hand hygiene, social distancing.

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.introduction: Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.
diseases.causes: Caused by Plasmodium species, transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood smear test, rapid diagnostic test (RDT).
diseases.treatment: Antimalarial drugs such as chloroquine or artemisinin-based therapies.
diseases.prevention: Insecticide-treated bed nets, antimalarial prophylaxis, mosquito control.

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.introduction: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.
diseases.causes: Bacteria, viruses, or fungi infecting the lungs.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, blood tests, sputum culture.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics (if bacterial), antivirals, supportive care.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination (pneumococcal vaccine), good hygiene.

diseases.name: Dengue Fever
diseases.introduction: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne viral infection.
diseases.causes: Caused by Dengue virus, transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood test for dengue antigens or antibodies.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care (fluids, pain relievers).
diseases.prevention: Mosquito control, avoiding mosquito bites.

diseases.name: Typhoid Fever
diseases.introduction: Typhoid is a bacterial infection spread through contaminated food or water.
diseases.causes: Caused by Salmonella Typhi.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood culture, stool test.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as ciprofloxacin or ceftriaxone.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, safe food and water practices.

diseases.name: HIV/AIDS
diseases.introduction: HIV is a virus that attacks the immune system, leading to AIDS if untreated.
diseases.causes: Caused by Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV).
diseases.diagnosis: Blood test for HIV antibodies and viral load.
diseases.treatment: Antiretroviral therapy (ART).
diseases.prevention: Safe sex, clean needles, PrEP medication.

diseases.name: Cholera
diseases.introduction: Cholera is an acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine.
diseases.causes: Caused by Vibrio cholerae, spread through contaminated water and food.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool culture, rapid dipstick test.
diseases.treatment: Oral rehydration solution (ORS), antibiotics in severe cases.
diseases.prevention: Safe water and sanitation, cholera vaccine.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
diseases.introduction: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver.
diseases.causes: Caused by Hepatitis B virus (HBV), transmitted via blood and bodily fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood test for hepatitis B surface antigen.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications, liver monitoring.
diseases.prevention: Hepatitis B vaccination, safe sex, avoiding shared needles.

diseases.name: Lyme Disease
diseases.introduction: A tick-borne illness caused by Borrelia bacteria.
diseases.causes: Infection from Borrelia burgdorferi bacteria transmitted through tick bites.
diseases.diagnosis: ELISA test, Western blot, clinical evaluation.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics (doxycycline, amoxicillin).
diseases.prevention: Tick repellent, protective clothing, prompt tick removal.

diseases.name: Measles
diseases.introduction: A highly contagious viral infection affecting the respiratory system.
diseases.causes: Infection by measles virus through airborne droplets.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical examination, IgM antibody test, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, vitamin A supplementation.
diseases.prevention: MMR vaccine, isolation of infected individuals.

diseases.name: Rabies
diseases.introduction: A fatal viral disease affecting the central nervous system.
diseases.causes: Rabies virus transmitted through animal bites.
diseases.diagnosis: Direct fluorescent antibody test, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Post-exposure prophylaxis (vaccine + immunoglobulin).
diseases.prevention: Animal vaccination, avoid contact with wild animals.

diseases.name: Ebola Virus Disease
diseases.introduction: A severe hemorrhagic fever with high mortality rates.
diseases.causes: Ebola virus transmission via bodily fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: Antigen-capture ELISA, PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, monoclonal antibodies (Inmazeb).
diseases.prevention: PPE use, safe burial practices, outbreak containment.

diseases.name: Zika Virus Infection
diseases.introduction: A mosquito-borne disease linked to birth defects.
diseases.causes: Zika virus transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR testing, serology tests.
diseases.treatment: Symptomatic relief, rest.
diseases.prevention: Mosquito control, pregnancy travel advisories.

diseases.name: Chickenpox
diseases.introduction: A highly contagious viral infection causing itchy blisters.
diseases.causes: Varicella-zoster virus transmission via airborne droplets.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical examination, PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Antivirals (acyclovir), calamine lotion.
diseases.prevention: Varicella vaccine.

diseases.name: Polio
diseases.introduction: A crippling viral disease affecting motor neurons.
diseases.causes: Poliovirus spread via fecal-oral route.
diseases.diagnosis: Viral culture, PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, physical therapy.
diseases.prevention: Polio vaccination (IPV/OPV).

diseases.name: Tetanus
diseases.introduction: A bacterial infection causing severe muscle spasms.
diseases.causes: Clostridium tetani entering wounds via soil.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical evaluation, no lab tests.
diseases.treatment: Tetanus immunoglobulin, antibiotics, wound care.
diseases.prevention: Tetanus toxoid vaccine.

diseases.name: Leptospirosis
diseases.introduction: Leptospirosis is a bacterial infection that affects humans and animals. It is spread through water contaminated by the urine of infected animals.
diseases.causes: Caused by bacteria of the genus Leptospira, typically spread through contaminated water.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests, urine tests, and PCR tests for Leptospira bacteria.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as doxycycline or penicillin.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with contaminated water, wearing protective clothing, vaccination for animals.

diseases.name: Norovirus Infection
diseases.introduction: Norovirus is a highly contagious virus that causes vomiting and diarrhea.
diseases.causes: Caused by norovirus, spread through contaminated food, water, or surfaces.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool test to detect norovirus.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including hydration and rest.
diseases.prevention: Hand hygiene, safe food handling, disinfection of contaminated surfaces.

diseases.name: Brucellosis
diseases.introduction: Brucellosis is a bacterial infection that spreads from animals to humans, often through unpasteurized dairy products.
diseases.causes: Caused by bacteria of the genus Brucella, transmitted through unpasteurized milk, cheese, or direct contact with infected animals.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood culture, serologic tests, or PCR tests.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as doxycycline combined with rifampin.
diseases.prevention: Avoid unpasteurized dairy, wear protective gear when handling animals.

diseases.name: Histoplasmosis
diseases.introduction: Histoplasmosis is a fungal infection that primarily affects the lungs and is caused by inhaling spores of a fungus found in soil.
diseases.causes: Caused by inhaling spores of Histoplasma capsulatum fungus found in soil, especially near bird or bat droppings.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, fungal culture, antigen detection in blood or urine.
diseases.treatment: Antifungal medications such as itraconazole.
diseases.prevention: Avoid exposure to soil contaminated with bird or bat droppings, use protective masks when working in contaminated areas.

diseases.name: Anthrax
diseases.introduction: Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by Bacillus anthracis, which can be found in soil.
diseases.causes: Caused by Bacillus anthracis bacteria, spread through spores.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood culture, skin biopsy, chest X-ray, or CT scan.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics and antitoxins.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, avoiding contact with infected animals or contaminated products.

diseases.name: Candidiasis
diseases.introduction: Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by Candida species, often affecting the skin, mouth, or genitals.
diseases.causes: Overgrowth of Candida fungus, often due to weakened immune system or antibiotics.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical exam, microscopic examination, culture test.
diseases.treatment: Antifungal medications (fluconazole or topical creams).
diseases.prevention: Good hygiene, balanced diet, avoiding unnecessary antibiotics.

diseases.name: Plague
diseases.introduction: Plague is a serious bacterial infection caused by Yersinia pestis, typically transmitted through flea bites.
diseases.causes: Caused by Yersinia pestis bacteria, spread by fleas on infected animals.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood culture, lymph node aspirate, or sputum sample.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as streptomycin or gentamicin.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding rodent habitats, flea control, protective clothing.

diseases.name: Q Fever
diseases.introduction: Q Fever is a bacterial infection caused by Coxiella burnetii, often transmitted through animals.
diseases.causes: Caused by Coxiella burnetii, spread via inhalation of contaminated dust.
diseases.diagnosis: Serologic tests, PCR, and blood culture.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics like doxycycline.
diseases.prevention: Proper handling of livestock, pasteurization of milk.

diseases.name: Legionnaires' Disease
diseases.introduction: Legionnaires' Disease is a severe form of pneumonia caused by Legionella bacteria.
diseases.causes: Caused by inhaling water droplets containing Legionella bacteria.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, urine antigen test, culture of respiratory secretions.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as levofloxacin or azithromycin.
diseases.prevention: Regular cleaning of water systems, avoiding stagnant water.

diseases.name: Rotavirus Infection
diseases.introduction: Rotavirus is a common virus that causes severe diarrhea in infants and young children.
diseases.causes: Caused by rotavirus, spread through fecal-oral transmission.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool test for rotavirus antigens.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including oral rehydration.
diseases.prevention: Rotavirus vaccine, hand hygiene.

diseases.name: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Hantavirus is a rare but severe respiratory disease caused by hantaviruses, typically transmitted through rodent droppings.
diseases.causes: Inhalation of particles contaminated by rodent urine or droppings.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests, PCR tests.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care and oxygen therapy.
diseases.prevention: Rodent control, proper cleaning methods.

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.introduction: Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition characterized by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, causing recurring episodes of breathing difficulties.
symptoms: Trouble sleeping due to breathing problems
diseases.causes: Caused by genetic and environmental factors, triggers include allergens, respiratory infections, and air pollutants.
diseases.diagnosis: Medical history, physical examination, lung function tests (spirometry), peak flow measurement.
diseases.treatment: Inhaled corticosteroids, bronchodilators, leukotriene modifiers, and lifestyle management.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding triggers, maintaining good respiratory health, adherence to medication regimens.

diseases.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diseases.introduction: Diabetes is a metabolic disorder characterized by high blood glucose levels resulting from defects in insulin production, insulin action, or both.
diseases.causes: Type 1 is autoimmune; Type 2 is associated with insulin resistance, obesity, and genetic factors.
diseases.diagnosis: Fasting plasma glucose test, oral glucose tolerance test, HbA1c test.
diseases.treatment: Insulin therapy, oral medications, lifestyle modifications including diet and exercise.
diseases.prevention: Maintaining healthy weight, regular physical activity, balanced diet (primarily for Type 2).

diseases.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diseases.introduction: Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic inflammatory disorder affecting the joints and sometimes multiple organs.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks the synovium (joint lining).
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, blood tests (rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP antibodies), imaging studies.
diseases.treatment: Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), biologics, JAK inhibitors, pain management.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention, early diagnosis and treatment can limit progression.

diseases.name: Parkinson's Disease
diseases.introduction: Parkinson's disease is a progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement.
diseases.causes: Degeneration of neurons in the substantia nigra that produce dopamine, exact cause unknown.
diseases.diagnosis: Medical history, neurological examination, response to levodopa, DaTscan imaging.
diseases.treatment: Levodopa, dopamine agonists, MAO-B inhibitors, physical therapy.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention, research suggests exercise may reduce risk.

diseases.name: Alzheimer's Disease
diseases.introduction: Alzheimer's is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder causing brain cells to deteriorate and die.
diseases.causes: Abnormal protein deposits (amyloid plaques and tau tangles) in the brain, genetic and environmental factors.
diseases.diagnosis: Cognitive and neuropsychological tests, brain imaging, biomarker tests.
diseases.treatment: Cholinesterase inhibitors, memantine, supportive care and symptom management.
diseases.prevention: No definitive prevention, lifestyle factors like exercise, diet, and cognitive stimulation may help.

diseases.name: Giardiasis
diseases.introduction: Giardiasis is an intestinal infection caused by the microscopic parasite Giardia lamblia.
diseases.causes: Ingestion of Giardia cysts through contaminated water, food, or direct contact with infected individuals.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool examination, immunoassays, intestinal biopsy in rare cases.
diseases.treatment: Antiparasitic medications like metronidazole, tinidazole, or nitazoxanide.
diseases.prevention: Proper hygiene, avoiding untreated water, safe food handling practices.

diseases.name: Schistosomiasis
diseases.introduction: Schistosomiasis is a parasitic disease caused by blood flukes (trematode worms) of the genus Schistosoma.
diseases.causes: Infection occurs when larval forms of the parasite penetrate the skin during contact with infested water.
diseases.diagnosis: Microscopic identification of eggs in stool or urine, antibody tests, rectal or bladder biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Praziquantel is the primary medication used to treat all forms of schistosomiasis.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding wading or swimming in freshwater in endemic areas, improved sanitation.

diseases.name: Crohn's Disease
diseases.introduction: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease causing inflammation of the digestive tract lining.
diseases.causes: Immune system malfunction, genetic and environmental factors.
diseases.diagnosis: Colonoscopy, CT scan, MRI, capsule endoscopy, blood tests, stool tests.
diseases.treatment: Anti-inflammatory drugs, immune system suppressors, biologics, antibiotics, nutritional support.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention, management focuses on maintaining remission.

diseases.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diseases.introduction: Multiple sclerosis is a potential disabling disease of the brain and spinal cord where the immune system attacks the protective sheath (myelin) covering nerve fibers.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune response targeting the central nervous system, influenced by genetic and environmental factors.
diseases.diagnosis: MRI, spinal fluid analysis, evoked potential tests, blood tests to rule out other conditions.
diseases.treatment: Disease-modifying therapies, corticosteroids for relapses, physical therapy.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention, maintaining vitamin D levels may reduce risk.

diseases.name: Salmonellosis
diseases.introduction: Salmonellosis is a bacterial infection that affects the intestinal tract, caused by Salmonella bacteria.
diseases.causes: Consuming food or water contaminated with Salmonella bacteria, often from animal products.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool culture, blood tests, and clinical evaluation.
diseases.treatment: Fluid replacement, antibiotics for severe cases or vulnerable populations.
diseases.prevention: Proper food handling, thorough cooking of animal products, hand hygiene.

diseases.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
diseases.introduction: COPD is a chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.
diseases.causes: Long-term exposure to irritating gases or particulate matter, most often from cigarette smoke.
diseases.diagnosis: Pulmonary function tests, chest X-ray, CT scan, arterial blood gas analysis.
diseases.treatment: Bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, pulmonary rehabilitation, oxygen therapy.
diseases.prevention: Smoking cessation, avoiding air pollutants, respiratory vaccination.

diseases.name: Cryptosporidiosis
diseases.introduction: Cryptosporidiosis is a diarrheal disease caused by microscopic parasites of the genus Cryptosporidium.
diseases.causes: Ingestion of Cryptosporidium oocysts through contaminated water, food, or direct contact.
diseases.diagnosis: Modified acid-fast staining of stool samples, immunofluorescence assays, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Nitazoxanide (FDA-approved), supportive care, rehydration.
diseases.prevention: Water treatment, good hygiene practices, avoiding contaminated water sources.

diseases.name: Tularemia
diseases.introduction: Tularemia is a rare infectious disease that can attack the skin, eyes, lymph nodes, lungs, and other organs.
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Francisella tularensis, often transmitted by ticks, deer flies, or contact with infected animals.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests, culture of the bacteria, PCR assays.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics such as streptomycin, gentamicin, doxycycline, or ciprofloxacin.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with wild animals, using insect repellent, wearing protective clothing.

diseases.name: Syphilis
diseases.introduction: Syphilis is a bacterial infection usually spread by sexual contact that starts as a painless sore.
symptoms: Skin rash, fever, swollen lymph nodes (secondary stage)
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum, primarily transmitted through sexual contact.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests (VDRL, RPR, FTA-ABS), dark-field microscopy, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Penicillin is the preferred treatment; alternatives include doxycycline or ceftriaxone.
diseases.prevention: Safe sex practices, regular STI screening, partner notification and treatment.

diseases.name: Leprosy
diseases.introduction: Leprosy, also known as Hansen's disease, is a chronic infectious disease that causes skin lesions and nerve damage.
diseases.causes: Caused by Mycobacterium leprae, transmission occurs through prolonged close contact with untreated individuals.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical examination, skin or nerve biopsy, acid-fast bacilli smears.
diseases.treatment: Multidrug therapy (MDT) combining dapsone, rifampicin, and clofazimine.
diseases.prevention: Early diagnosis and treatment of cases, BCG vaccination may provide some protection.

diseases.name: Filariasis
diseases.introduction: Lymphatic filariasis, commonly known as elephantiasis, is a neglected tropical disease caused by filarial parasites.
diseases.causes: Transmitted by mosquitoes carrying filarial nematode worms that lodge in the lymphatic system.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood smear examination for microfilariae, antigen detection tests, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Albendazole with either ivermectin or diethylcarbamazine citrate (DEC).
diseases.prevention: Mosquito control measures, mass drug administration in endemic areas.
diseases.pathogen_name: Wuchereria bancrofti, Brugia malayi, Brugia timori

diseases.name: Cysticercosis
diseases.introduction: Cysticercosis is a tissue infection caused by larval cysts of the pork tapeworm Taenia solium.
diseases.causes: Ingestion of Taenia solium eggs through contaminated food or water, or via fecal-oral route.
diseases.diagnosis: Neuroimaging (CT, MRI), blood tests for antibodies, biopsy in some cases.
diseases.treatment: Antiparasitic drugs (albendazole, praziquantel), anti-seizure medications, corticosteroids.
diseases.prevention: Proper sanitation, thorough cooking of pork, improved personal hygiene.

diseases.name: Psoriasis
diseases.introduction: Psoriasis is a chronic skin disorder that causes cells to build up rapidly on the skin surface, forming thick silvery scales and itchy, dry, red patches.
symptoms: Red patches of skin with silvery scales
Dry, cracked skin that may bleed
diseases.causes: Immune system dysfunction causing accelerated skin cell growth, with genetic and environmental triggers.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, skin biopsy, medical history.
diseases.treatment: Topical treatments, phototherapy, systemic medications, biologics.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention, management focuses on identifying and avoiding triggers.

diseases.name: Yellow Fever
diseases.introduction: Yellow fever is a viral disease transmitted by infected mosquitoes, characterized by fever, jaundice, and hemorrhage.
diseases.causes: Caused by the yellow fever virus and transmitted by infected Aedes or Haemagogus mosquitoes.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for viral antigens or antibodies, PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care focused on managing symptoms, no specific antiviral treatment.
diseases.prevention: Yellow fever vaccination, mosquito control measures, personal protection against mosquito bites.

diseases.name: Leishmaniasis
diseases.introduction: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease spread by the bite of infected sand flies, with cutaneous, mucocutaneous, and visceral forms.
symptoms: Fever, weight loss, enlarged spleen and liver (visceral)
diseases.causes: Caused by Leishmania parasites transmitted through the bite of infected female phlebotomine sand flies.
diseases.diagnosis: Parasite identification in tissue samples, serological tests, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Pentavalent antimonial compounds, amphotericin B, miltefosine, or paromomycin.
diseases.prevention: Vector control, protective clothing, insect repellent, bed nets in endemic areas.

diseases.name: Chagas Disease
diseases.introduction: Chagas disease is a potentially life-threatening illness caused by the protozoan parasite Trypanosoma cruzi.
diseases.causes: Transmitted to humans through contact with feces of triatomine bugs (kissing bugs), blood transfusion, or congenital transmission.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood smear examination, serology for antibodies, PCR.
diseases.treatment: Benznidazole and nifurtimox for acute phase; symptom management for chronic phase.
diseases.prevention: Vector control, screening blood donors, improved housing in endemic areas.

diseases.name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
diseases.introduction: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) is a progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to loss of muscle control.
diseases.causes: Exact cause unknown in most cases. 5-10% of cases are familial due to genetic mutations. Environmental factors may contribute.
diseases.diagnosis: Neurological examination, EMG, nerve conduction studies, MRI, blood tests to rule out other conditions, genetic testing.
diseases.treatment: Riluzole and edaravone (FDA-approved medications), supportive care, physical therapy, respiratory support.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention methods. Genetic counseling for familial cases.

diseases.name: Glaucoma
diseases.introduction: Glaucoma is a group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often caused by abnormally high pressure in the eye.
diseases.causes: Usually caused by elevated intraocular pressure damaging the optic nerve. Risk factors include age, family history, and ethnicity.
diseases.diagnosis: Tonometry (measuring eye pressure), visual field test, ophthalmoscopy, gonioscopy, pachymetry.
diseases.treatment: Eye drops to reduce pressure, oral medications, laser therapy, surgery in advanced cases.
diseases.prevention: Regular eye exams for early detection, especially for high-risk individuals.

diseases.name: Ulcerative Colitis
diseases.introduction: Ulcerative colitis is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract, primarily affecting the colon and rectum.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune response in genetically susceptible individuals, possibly triggered by environmental factors.
diseases.diagnosis: Colonoscopy with biopsy, sigmoidoscopy, blood tests, stool tests, imaging studies.
diseases.treatment: Anti-inflammatory drugs, immunosuppressants, biologics, surgery in severe cases.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention. Management focuses on maintaining remission and preventing flare-ups.

diseases.name: Sarcoidosis
diseases.introduction: Sarcoidosis is a disease characterized by the growth of tiny collections of inflammatory cells (granulomas) in different parts of the body, most commonly the lungs and lymph nodes.
diseases.causes: Unknown. Believed to result from immune system response to an unidentified trigger in genetically predisposed individuals.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, pulmonary function tests, tissue biopsy, bronchoscopy, blood tests.
diseases.treatment: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, antimalarial medications, TNF-alpha inhibitors.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention methods.

diseases.name: Hemochromatosis
diseases.introduction: Hemochromatosis is a disorder where too much iron builds up in the body, potentially damaging organs like the liver, heart, and pancreas.
diseases.causes: Primarily hereditary due to mutations in the HFE gene. Secondary hemochromatosis can result from certain anemias, liver diseases, or blood transfusions.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for iron levels and genetic testing, liver biopsy in some cases.
diseases.treatment: Regular phlebotomy (blood removal), iron chelation therapy, treating complications.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling for families with history, avoiding iron supplements if at risk.

diseases.name: Coccidioidomycosis
diseases.introduction: Coccidioidomycosis, also known as Valley Fever, is a fungal infection caused by breathing in the Coccidioides fungus found in soil in certain areas.
diseases.causes: Infection by Coccidioides immitis or Coccidioides posadasii fungi, primarily through inhalation of airborne spores.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, sputum culture, blood tests for antibodies, skin tests.
diseases.treatment: Antifungal medications (fluconazole, itraconazole) for severe or persistent cases. Mild cases may resolve without treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding dust in endemic areas, wearing masks during dusty conditions in these regions.

diseases.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Sjögren's syndrome is an autoimmune disorder characterized by dry eyes and dry mouth, often accompanied by other autoimmune diseases.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune response where white blood cells attack moisture-producing glands. Genetic and environmental factors may contribute.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for autoantibodies, eye tests, salivary gland tests, lip biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Artificial tears and saliva, medications to stimulate saliva production, immunosuppressants for systemic symptoms.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention methods.

diseases.name: Japanese Encephalitis
diseases.introduction: Japanese encephalitis is a mosquito-borne viral infection of the brain caused by the Japanese encephalitis virus.
diseases.causes: Transmitted by Culex mosquitoes infected with the Japanese encephalitis virus, often found in rural areas near rice fields.
diseases.diagnosis: Serological testing for virus-specific antibodies, PCR of cerebrospinal fluid or tissue samples.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care to manage symptoms. No specific antiviral treatment available.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, mosquito control measures, using insect repellent, wearing protective clothing.

diseases.name: Amebiasis
diseases.introduction: Amebiasis is an intestinal infection caused by the parasite Entamoeba histolytica, which can spread to other organs.
diseases.causes: Ingestion of food or water contaminated with Entamoeba histolytica cysts.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool microscopy, antigen detection tests, antibody tests, liver imaging for abscesses.
diseases.treatment: Metronidazole followed by paromomycin or diloxanide furoate to eliminate cysts.
diseases.prevention: Improved sanitation, safe water and food handling, hand hygiene.

diseases.name: Chikungunya
diseases.introduction: Chikungunya is a viral disease transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes, causing fever and severe joint pain.
diseases.causes: Caused by the chikungunya virus, transmitted primarily by Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus mosquitoes.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for virus isolation, PCR for viral RNA, serological tests for antibodies.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including rest, fluids, and medications for pain and fever. No specific antiviral treatment.
diseases.prevention: Mosquito control measures, using insect repellent, wearing protective clothing, staying in screened areas.

diseases.name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
diseases.introduction: Ankylosing spondylitis is an inflammatory disease that can cause some of the small bones in the spine to fuse, leading to a hunched posture.
symptoms: Pain in hips, shoulders, and heels
diseases.causes: Genetic factors play a role, particularly the HLA-B27 gene. Environmental triggers may initiate the disease in susceptible individuals.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, X-rays, MRI, blood tests including HLA-B27.
diseases.treatment: NSAIDs, TNF blockers, IL-17 inhibitors, physical therapy, exercise.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention. Early diagnosis and treatment can help manage symptoms and slow progression.

diseases.name: African Trypanosomiasis
diseases.introduction: African trypanosomiasis, also known as sleeping sickness, is a parasitic disease transmitted by the tsetse fly.
diseases.causes: Caused by Trypanosoma brucei gambiense or Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense, transmitted through the bite of infected tsetse flies.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests, lymph node aspirate, cerebrospinal fluid examination.
diseases.treatment: Pentamidine, suramin, eflornithine, nifurtimox, melarsoprol depending on disease stage and type.
diseases.prevention: Tsetse fly control, wearing protective clothing, avoiding areas with high fly populations.

diseases.name: Hemophilia
diseases.introduction: Hemophilia is a rare bleeding disorder where blood doesn't clot properly due to insufficient clotting factors.
symptoms: Excessive bleeding from cuts or injuries
diseases.causes: Genetic disorder caused by mutations in genes that provide instructions for clotting factors, primarily inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests measuring clotting factor levels, genetic testing.
diseases.treatment: Clotting factor replacement therapy, desmopressin, antifibrinolytics, gene therapy (emerging).
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling for families with history. No primary prevention for new mutations.

diseases.name: Huntington's Disease
diseases.introduction: Huntington's disease is a progressive genetic disorder causing the breakdown of nerve cells in the brain, affecting movement, cognition, and psychiatric health.
diseases.causes: Autosomal dominant genetic disorder caused by CAG repeat expansion in the HTT gene.
diseases.diagnosis: Genetic testing, neurological examination, brain imaging, family history assessment.
diseases.treatment: Symptomatic treatment with medications for movement and psychiatric symptoms, physical therapy, occupational therapy.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling and testing for at-risk individuals. No prevention for those with the mutation.

diseases.name: Addison's Disease
diseases.introduction: Addison's disease is a disorder in which the adrenal glands do not produce enough hormones, particularly cortisol and aldosterone.
diseases.causes: Usually autoimmune (primary adrenal insufficiency). Can also be caused by tuberculosis, fungal infections, cancer, or pituitary gland disorders.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood and urine tests, ACTH stimulation test, imaging of adrenal and pituitary glands.
diseases.treatment: Hormone replacement therapy with glucocorticoids and mineralocorticoids, managing stress and illness.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention for autoimmune form. Treatment of underlying causes when identified.

diseases.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diseases.introduction: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is a chronic autoimmune disease that can affect various body systems, including joints, skin, kidneys, heart, lungs, and brain.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks the body's own tissues. Genetic, environmental, and hormonal factors contribute.
diseases.diagnosis: Antinuclear antibody (ANA) test, specific antibody tests, complete blood count, urinalysis, tissue biopsies.
diseases.treatment: NSAIDs, antimalarials, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, biologics, lifestyle modifications.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention. Sun protection helps prevent flares in photosensitive individuals.

diseases.name: Onchocerciasis
diseases.introduction: Onchocerciasis, also known as river blindness, is a parasitic disease caused by the filarial worm Onchocerca volvulus, transmitted by blackfly bites.
diseases.causes: Infection with Onchocerca volvulus, transmitted through the bite of infected blackflies of the genus Simulium.
diseases.diagnosis: Skin snips for microscopic examination, slit lamp examination, antibody tests.
diseases.treatment: Ivermectin administered once or twice yearly until the parasite dies out.
diseases.prevention: Vector control, preventive chemotherapy with ivermectin in endemic areas.

diseases.name: Paget's Disease of Bone
diseases.introduction: Paget's disease of bone is a chronic disorder that causes enlarged and misshapen bones due to excessive breakdown and formation of bone tissue.
diseases.causes: Unknown. Genetic factors and viral infections may play a role.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for alkaline phosphatase levels, bone scans, X-rays, bone biopsy in some cases.
diseases.treatment: Bisphosphonates, calcitonin, pain management, surgery for complications.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention methods.

diseases.name: West Nile Virus Infection
diseases.introduction: West Nile virus infection is a mosquito-borne disease that can cause a fatal neurological disease in humans, though about 80% of infected people remain asymptomatic.
diseases.causes: Infection with West Nile virus, primarily transmitted through the bite of infected Culex mosquitoes.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood or cerebrospinal fluid tests for virus-specific antibodies or viral RNA.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care for symptoms. No specific antiviral treatment available.
diseases.prevention: Mosquito control measures, using insect repellent, wearing protective clothing, eliminating standing water.

diseases.name: Celiac Disease
diseases.introduction: Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder where ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine in genetically predisposed individuals.
diseases.causes: Immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. Genetic factors play a significant role.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for specific antibodies, small intestine biopsy, genetic testing.
diseases.treatment: Strict gluten-free diet, nutritional supplements for deficiencies, medication for associated conditions.
diseases.prevention: No prevention for the genetic predisposition. Disease activity is controlled through gluten avoidance.

diseases.name: Clostridium difficile Infection
diseases.introduction: Clostridium difficile infection is a bacterial infection that causes diarrhea and more serious intestinal conditions like colitis, often occurring after antibiotic use.
diseases.causes: Infection with Clostridioides difficile bacteria, often following disruption of normal gut flora by antibiotics.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool tests for C. difficile toxins, PCR testing, colonoscopy in severe cases.
diseases.treatment: Discontinuation of inciting antibiotics when possible, oral vancomycin, fidaxomicin, bezlotoxumab, fecal microbiota transplant for recurrent cases.
diseases.prevention: Judicious antibiotic use, infection control measures, hand hygiene, environmental cleaning.

diseases.name: Acromegaly
diseases.introduction: Acromegaly is a hormonal disorder that develops when the pituitary gland produces too much growth hormone during adulthood, causing abnormal growth of body tissues, especially in the hands, feet and face.
diseases.causes: Usually caused by a benign tumor (adenoma) of the pituitary gland. Rarely, tumors in other parts of the body produce growth hormone.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for IGF-1 and growth hormone levels, glucose tolerance test, pituitary MRI.
diseases.treatment: Surgery to remove pituitary tumor, medication to control growth hormone production, radiation therapy in some cases.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention for the initial tumor development.

diseases.name: Cystic Fibrosis
diseases.introduction: Cystic fibrosis is an inherited disorder that causes severe damage to the lungs, digestive system, and other organs by affecting cells that produce mucus, sweat, and digestive juices.
diseases.causes: Mutations in the CFTR gene that regulates the movement of salt and water in and out of cells.
diseases.diagnosis: Sweat test, genetic testing, newborn screening, lung function tests.
diseases.treatment: CFTR modulators, airway clearance techniques, mucus-thinning medications, antibiotics, pancreatic enzyme supplements.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling for families with history. No prevention for those with the mutations.

diseases.name: Graves' Disease
diseases.introduction: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder that causes overactivity of the thyroid gland (hyperthyroidism), resulting in excessive production of thyroid hormones.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune disorder where antibodies target the thyroid gland, causing overproduction of thyroid hormones.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, blood tests for thyroid hormones and TSI antibodies, radioactive iodine uptake test.
diseases.treatment: Anti-thyroid medications, radioactive iodine therapy, beta-blockers, thyroid surgery in some cases.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention. Early treatment helps prevent complications.

diseases.name: Vitiligo
diseases.introduction: Vitiligo is a long-term condition where pale white patches develop on the skin due to lack of melanin, the pigment that gives skin its color.
symptoms: Loss of color in the tissues inside the mouth
Loss of color in the inner layer of the eye
diseases.causes: Autoimmune condition where the immune system attacks and destroys melanocytes. Genetic factors may increase susceptibility.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, Wood's lamp examination, skin biopsy, blood tests to check for related autoimmune conditions.
diseases.treatment: Topical corticosteroids, calcineurin inhibitors, phototherapy, depigmentation in severe cases, surgical techniques.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention. Sun protection important to prevent damage to affected areas.

diseases.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is a hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age, characterized by enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges.
diseases.causes: Exact cause unknown. Factors include insulin resistance, low-grade inflammation, heredity, and excess androgen production.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, pelvic exam, ultrasound, blood tests for hormones and glucose tolerance.
diseases.treatment: Hormonal birth control, anti-androgen medications, metformin, lifestyle modifications, fertility treatments if desired.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention. Weight management and early treatment help control symptoms and complications.

diseases.name: Gaucher Disease
diseases.introduction: Gaucher disease is a rare genetic disorder in which a fatty substance (glucocerebroside) accumulates in cells and certain organs due to enzyme deficiency.
diseases.causes: Mutations in the GBA gene that provides instructions for making the enzyme glucocerebrosidase.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for enzyme activity, genetic testing, bone marrow aspiration, imaging studies.
diseases.treatment: Enzyme replacement therapy, substrate reduction therapy, bone marrow transplantation in severe cases.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling for at-risk families. Prenatal diagnosis possible.

diseases.name: Acinetobacter Infection
diseases.introduction: Acinetobacter infections are caused by bacteria commonly found in soil and water. They typically occur in intensive care settings and can cause various types of infections.
diseases.causes: Infection with Acinetobacter baumannii or related species, often in healthcare settings and among immunocompromised patients.
diseases.diagnosis: Bacterial cultures from affected sites, antimicrobial susceptibility testing.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics based on susceptibility testing, often carbapenems, polymyxins, or tigecycline.
diseases.prevention: Infection control measures in healthcare settings, hand hygiene, environmental cleaning, antibiotic stewardship.

diseases.name: Porphyria
diseases.introduction: Porphyria is a group of disorders caused by buildup of natural chemicals that produce porphyrin, which helps hemoglobin work properly.
diseases.causes: Genetic mutations affecting the enzymes involved in heme production, sometimes triggered by drugs, diet, hormones, or sun exposure.
diseases.diagnosis: Urine and blood tests for porphyrins and precursors, genetic testing.
diseases.treatment: Avoiding triggers, pain management, intravenous heme, glucose infusions, phlebotomy for some types.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding known triggers, genetic counseling for families with history.

diseases.name: Cytomegalovirus Infection
diseases.introduction: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection is a common viral infection that rarely causes symptoms in healthy people but can be serious in immunocompromised individuals and newborns.
diseases.causes: Infection with human cytomegalovirus, transmitted through body fluids including saliva, blood, urine, semen, and breast milk.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for antibodies, PCR for viral DNA, virus culture, tissue biopsy in specific cases.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications (ganciclovir, valganciclovir) for severe cases, supportive care for mild cases.
diseases.prevention: Hand hygiene, avoiding sharing personal items, safe sex practices, screening pregnant women.

diseases.name: Guillain-Barré Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Guillain-Barré syndrome is a rare disorder where the body's immune system attacks the peripheral nervous system, causing muscle weakness and sometimes paralysis.
symptoms: Weakness or tingling in legs that spreads to arms and upper body
Difficulty with eye movement, speaking, chewing, or swallowing
diseases.causes: Exact cause unknown. Often follows a respiratory or gastrointestinal viral infection. Rarely associated with vaccination.
diseases.diagnosis: Cerebrospinal fluid analysis, nerve conduction studies, electromyography.
diseases.treatment: Plasma exchange, intravenous immunoglobulin, supportive care, physical therapy.
diseases.prevention: No specific prevention. Treating infections promptly may reduce risk.

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.introduction: Endometriosis is a disorder in which tissue similar to the tissue that normally lines the inside of the uterus grows outside the uterus.
symptoms: Pain with bowel movements or urination
diseases.causes: Possible causes include retrograde menstruation, cellular metaplasia, genetic factors, immune system dysfunction, and environmental factors.
diseases.diagnosis: Pelvic exam, ultrasound, MRI, laparoscopy with tissue biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Pain medications, hormone therapy, conservative surgery, hysterectomy in severe cases, fertility treatment if needed.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention. Hormonal birth control may reduce risk in some women.

diseases.name: Tay-Sachs Disease
diseases.introduction: Tay-Sachs disease is a rare inherited disorder that progressively destroys nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.
diseases.causes: Mutations in the HEXA gene, resulting in deficiency of hexosaminidase A enzyme and accumulation of GM2 ganglioside in neurons.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for hexosaminidase A enzyme activity, genetic testing, prenatal diagnosis.
diseases.treatment: No cure. Supportive care to manage symptoms and provide comfort.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling and screening for carriers, particularly in high-risk populations.

diseases.name: Cyclosporiasis
diseases.introduction: Cyclosporiasis is an intestinal illness caused by the microscopic parasite Cyclospora cayetanensis, typically acquired by consuming contaminated food or water.
diseases.causes: Ingestion of food or water contaminated with Cyclospora cayetanensis oocysts.
diseases.diagnosis: Stool examination with special laboratory techniques, PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole (TMP-SMX) is the primary treatment. Ciprofloxacin for those allergic to sulfa drugs.
diseases.prevention: Washing fruits and vegetables, drinking treated or bottled water, proper food handling and sanitation.

diseases.name: Fabry Disease
diseases.introduction: Fabry disease is a rare genetic disorder that results from the buildup of a particular type of fat in the body's cells due to enzyme deficiency.
diseases.causes: Mutations in the GLA gene, causing deficiency of alpha-galactosidase A enzyme and accumulation of globotriaosylceramide.
diseases.diagnosis: Alpha-galactosidase A enzyme activity test, genetic testing, tissue biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Enzyme replacement therapy, chaperone therapy, pain management, treatments for specific organ involvement.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling for families with history. No prevention for those with mutations.

diseases.name: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Stevens-Johnson syndrome is a rare, serious disorder of the skin and mucous membranes, often triggered by medication or infection.
symptoms: Painful red or purple rash that spreads
Blisters on skin and mucous membranes
diseases.causes: Typically a reaction to medications (antibiotics, anticonvulsants, NSAIDs) or infections. Genetic factors may increase susceptibility.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical examination, skin biopsy, medical history review.
diseases.treatment: Discontinuation of causative medication, supportive care in burn units or intensive care, pain management, fluid replacement, wound care.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding medications that previously caused reactions, genetic testing for HLA-B*1502 before carbamazepine use in high-risk populations.

diseases.name: Marfan Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Marfan syndrome is a genetic disorder that affects the body's connective tissue, which provides strength and flexibility to structures throughout the body.
symptoms: Disproportionately long arms, legs, and fingers
Stretch marks not related to weight changes
diseases.causes: Mutations in the FBN1 gene, which provides instructions for making fibrillin-1, a protein essential for elasticity in connective tissue.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical examination, family history, genetic testing, heart imaging, eye examination.
diseases.treatment: Beta-blockers or ARBs for heart protection, surgery for aortic or heart valve issues, eye care, orthopedic management.
diseases.prevention: Genetic counseling for family planning. No prevention for those with the mutation.

diseases.name: Mycoplasma Pneumonia
diseases.introduction: Mycoplasma pneumonia is a type of pneumonia caused by the bacterium Mycoplasma pneumoniae, often affecting younger people and resulting in a mild form of pneumonia.
symptoms: Persistent cough that may be dry or produce mucus
diseases.causes: Infection with Mycoplasma pneumoniae bacteria, spread through respiratory droplets from person to person.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, sputum culture, PCR testing, serological tests for antibodies.
diseases.treatment: Macrolide antibiotics (azithromycin, clarithromycin), fluoroquinolones, or tetracyclines.
diseases.prevention: Good hygiene practices, avoiding close contact with infected individuals, prompt treatment to prevent spread.

diseases.name: Primary Biliary Cholangitis
diseases.introduction: Primary biliary cholangitis is a chronic disease in which the bile ducts in the liver are slowly destroyed, leading to liver damage and sometimes cirrhosis.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune condition where the immune system attacks bile ducts in the liver. Genetic and environmental factors contribute.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for liver function and antibodies (anti-mitochondrial antibodies), imaging studies, liver biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA), obeticholic acid, fibrates, liver transplantation in advanced cases.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention. Early diagnosis and treatment may slow progression.

diseases.name: Toxoplasmosis
diseases.introduction: Toxoplasmosis is an infection caused by the parasite Toxoplasma gondii, which can be found in undercooked meat, contaminated water, and cat feces.
symptoms: Congenital defects if acquired during pregnancy
diseases.causes: Infection with Toxoplasma gondii parasite through ingestion of undercooked meat, contaminated water, or exposure to infected cat feces.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for antibodies, PCR for parasite DNA, amniocentesis for congenital infection.
diseases.treatment: Pyrimethamine and sulfadiazine with folinic acid for severe cases, trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole as alternative.
diseases.prevention: Cooking meat thoroughly, washing fruits and vegetables, hand hygiene after gardening or handling cat litter, avoiding changing cat litter during pregnancy.

diseases.name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
diseases.introduction: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (formerly called Wegener's granulomatosis) is a rare disorder that causes inflammation of the blood vessels in your nose, sinuses, throat, lungs and kidneys.
diseases.causes: Autoimmune condition where abnormal antibodies (ANCA) attack small and medium-sized blood vessels.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests for ANCA antibodies, tissue biopsy, imaging studies, urinalysis.
diseases.treatment: Corticosteroids, cyclophosphamide, rituximab, methotrexate, maintenance immunosuppressants.
diseases.prevention: No known prevention. Early diagnosis and treatment help prevent organ damage.

diseases.name: Stroke
diseases.introduction: A stroke occurs when there is a sudden disruption of blood flow to part of the brain, resulting in brain cell damage.
diseases.causes: Blockage or rupture of blood vessels in the brain, high blood pressure, heart disease, diabetes.
diseases.diagnosis: CT scan, MRI, physical exam, blood tests.
diseases.treatment: Thrombolytics, surgery, rehabilitation, blood pressure management.
diseases.prevention: Controlling blood pressure, healthy diet, regular exercise, smoking cessation.

diseases.name: Heart Disease (Coronary Artery Disease)
diseases.introduction: Coronary artery disease is caused by the build-up of plaque in the heart's arteries, leading to reduced blood flow to the heart muscle.
diseases.causes: Atherosclerosis, high cholesterol, smoking, high blood pressure, diabetes.
diseases.diagnosis: Electrocardiogram (ECG), stress test, angiography.
diseases.treatment: Medications (statins, aspirin), lifestyle changes, coronary angioplasty, bypass surgery.
diseases.prevention: Healthy diet, exercise, quitting smoking, managing blood pressure and cholesterol.

diseases.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
diseases.introduction: Hypertension is a condition where the force of the blood against the walls of the arteries is consistently too high.
diseases.causes: Genetics, obesity, physical inactivity, excessive salt intake, stress.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood pressure measurement, home blood pressure monitoring.
diseases.treatment: Antihypertensive medications, lifestyle changes, stress management.
diseases.prevention: Maintaining healthy weight, regular exercise, balanced diet, reducing salt intake.

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
diseases.introduction: Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease that causes the cartilage in joints to break down over time.
diseases.causes: Aging, joint injury, obesity, genetics.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical exam, X-rays, MRI, joint fluid analysis.
diseases.treatment: Pain relievers, anti-inflammatory drugs, physical therapy, joint replacement surgery.
diseases.prevention: Maintaining a healthy weight, regular exercise, avoiding joint injuries.

diseases.name: Kidney Disease (Chronic Kidney Disease)
diseases.introduction: Chronic kidney disease is a long-term condition where the kidneys progressively lose their ability to filter waste and excess fluids from the blood.
diseases.causes: Diabetes, high blood pressure, heart disease, genetics.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests, urine tests, kidney ultrasound, kidney biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Dialysis, medications, kidney transplant, lifestyle changes.
diseases.prevention: Managing blood pressure, controlling diabetes, avoiding excessive alcohol, maintaining kidney health.

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.introduction: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder that causes recurring seizures due to abnormal brain activity.
diseases.causes: Brain injury, genetic factors, infections, stroke, brain tumors.
diseases.diagnosis: EEG, MRI, CT scan, physical exam.
diseases.treatment: Anticonvulsant medications, surgery, lifestyle modifications.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding head injuries, controlling seizures, managing underlying conditions.

diseases.name: Cervical Cancer
diseases.introduction: Cervical cancer begins in the cells of the cervix, usually caused by persistent infection with high-risk types of human papillomavirus (HPV).
diseases.causes: HPV infection, smoking, multiple sexual partners, weakened immune system.
diseases.diagnosis: Pap smear, HPV test, colposcopy, biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy.
diseases.prevention: HPV vaccination, regular screenings, safe sexual practices.

diseases.name: Lung Cancer
diseases.introduction: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lungs and is primarily caused by smoking or exposure to toxins.
diseases.causes: Smoking, environmental exposure to toxins, family history, previous lung disease.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, CT scan, biopsy, PET scan.
diseases.treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted therapy.
diseases.prevention: Quitting smoking, avoiding exposure to toxins, regular screenings.

diseases.name: Breast Cancer
diseases.introduction: Breast cancer is a cancer that originates in the breast tissue, often in the milk ducts or lobules.
diseases.causes: Genetic mutations, family history, hormone therapy, radiation exposure.
diseases.diagnosis: Mammogram, ultrasound, biopsy, MRI.
diseases.treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, hormone therapy, targeted therapy.
diseases.prevention: Breast self-exams, regular screenings, healthy lifestyle.

diseases.name: Prostate Cancer
diseases.introduction: Prostate cancer is cancer that starts in the prostate, a small gland in men that produces seminal fluid.
symptoms: Pain in the lower back or hips
diseases.causes: Age, family history, high-fat diet, hormonal imbalances.
diseases.diagnosis: Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test, biopsy, ultrasound, MRI.
diseases.treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, hormone therapy, chemotherapy.
diseases.prevention: Healthy diet, regular screenings, avoiding tobacco use.

diseases.name: Anemia
diseases.introduction: Anemia is a condition where the body lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to tissues.
diseases.causes: Iron deficiency, chronic diseases, blood loss, vitamin B12 deficiency.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests (hemoglobin levels), bone marrow biopsy.
diseases.treatment: Iron supplements, vitamin B12 shots, blood transfusions, treating underlying causes.
diseases.prevention: Balanced diet rich in iron and vitamins, managing chronic conditions.

diseases.name: Tuberculosis (MDR-TB, XDR-TB)
diseases.introduction: Tuberculosis is an infectious disease primarily affecting the lungs, caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. MDR-TB and XDR-TB are drug-resistant forms.
diseases.causes: Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection, poor immune function, overcrowded conditions.
diseases.diagnosis: Chest X-ray, sputum test, skin test, PCR test.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics (for MDR-TB and XDR-TB, longer treatments with second-line drugs).
diseases.prevention: Vaccination (BCG), early detection, isolation of infectious individuals.

diseases.name: Malnutrition
diseases.introduction: Malnutrition refers to deficiencies, excesses, or imbalances in a person’s intake of energy and/or nutrients.
diseases.causes: Inadequate diet, digestive disorders, infections, poverty.
diseases.diagnosis: Blood tests, nutritional assessment.
diseases.treatment: Nutritional supplementation, balanced diet, addressing underlying causes.
diseases.prevention: Proper nutrition, public health programs, education on healthy diets.

diseases.name: Panic Disorder
diseases.introduction: Panic disorder is an anxiety disorder characterized by sudden and repeated episodes of intense fear or discomfort.
diseases.causes: Genetics, stress, abnormal brain activity, trauma.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical exam, psychological evaluation.
diseases.treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), medications (SSRIs, benzodiazepines).
diseases.prevention: Stress management, therapy, lifestyle changes.

diseases.name: Psoriatic Arthritis
diseases.introduction: Psoriatic arthritis is a form of arthritis affecting some people with psoriasis, characterized by joint pain and swelling.
diseases.causes: Genetics, immune system malfunction.
diseases.diagnosis: Physical exam, blood tests, X-rays, MRI.
diseases.treatment: Anti-inflammatory drugs, immunosuppressive medications, physical therapy.
diseases.prevention: Early diagnosis and treatment, managing psoriasis.

diseases.name: Smallpox
diseases.introduction: Smallpox is a contagious and sometimes fatal infectious disease caused by the variola virus. It was declared eradicated in 1980 following a global vaccination campaign.
diseases.causes: Caused by the variola virus, transmitted from person to person via respiratory droplets or contaminated objects.
diseases.diagnosis: Clinical evaluation of characteristic rash; laboratory tests to detect variola DNA.
diseases.treatment: No proven treatment; supportive care and antiviral medications like tecovirimat may help.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination; isolation of infected individuals.

diseases.name: Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS)
diseases.introduction: MERS is a viral respiratory illness caused by the MERS-CoV coronavirus, first identified in Saudi Arabia in 2012.
diseases.causes: Caused by MERS-CoV, transmitted through close contact with infected individuals or camels.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR testing of respiratory samples.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care; no specific antiviral treatment.
diseases.prevention: Regular handwashing, avoiding contact with camels, and following public health guidelines.

diseases.name: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS)
diseases.introduction: SARS is a viral respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV coronavirus, first identified in Asia in 2003.
diseases.causes: Caused by SARS-CoV, transmitted through respiratory droplets.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR testing of respiratory samples.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care; no specific antiviral treatment.
diseases.prevention: Good hygiene practices and avoiding close contact with infected individuals.

diseases.name: Lassa Fever
diseases.introduction: Lassa fever is an acute viral hemorrhagic illness endemic in West Africa, caused by the Lassa virus.
diseases.causes: Caused by Lassa virus, transmitted via contact with urine or feces of infected Mastomys rats.
diseases.diagnosis: ELISA to detect Lassa antigen or antibodies; PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral drug ribavirin; supportive care.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with rodents; maintaining good hygiene.

diseases.name: Rift Valley Fever
diseases.introduction: Rift Valley fever is a viral zoonosis affecting animals and humans, primarily in Africa, caused by the Rift Valley fever virus.
symptoms: Severe cases may involve hemorrhagic fever
diseases.causes: Caused by Rift Valley fever virus, transmitted through mosquito bites or contact with infected animal tissues.
diseases.diagnosis: ELISA to detect antibodies; PCR testing.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care; no specific antiviral treatment.
diseases.prevention: Controlling mosquito populations; avoiding contact with infected animals.

diseases.name: Nipah Virus Infection
diseases.introduction: Nipah virus infection is a zoonotic illness causing severe disease in both animals and humans, first identified in Malaysia in 1998.
diseases.causes: Caused by Nipah virus, transmitted from bats to humans, or through contaminated food or direct contact with infected individuals.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR testing of bodily fluids; ELISA to detect antibodies.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care; no specific antiviral treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding consumption of raw date palm sap; avoiding contact with bats and infected individuals.

diseases.name: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever
diseases.introduction: Crimean-Congo hemorrhagic fever is a widespread tick-borne viral disease, affecting both animals and humans, with a high case-fatality rate.
diseases.causes: Caused by Crimean-Congo hemorrhagic fever virus, transmitted by tick bites or contact with infected animal blood or tissues.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR testing; ELISA to detect antibodies.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral drug ribavirin; supportive care.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding tick bites; using protective clothing; controlling tick populations.

diseases.name: Avian Influenza (Bird Flu)
diseases.introduction: Avian influenza refers to influenza A viruses found chiefly in birds but can infect humans, causing severe respiratory illness.
diseases.causes: Caused by avian influenza viruses, transmitted through contact with infected birds or contaminated environments.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR testing of respiratory samples.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications like oseltamivir; supportive care.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with infected birds; proper cooking of poultry products.

diseases.name: Marburg Virus Disease
diseases.introduction: Marburg Virus Disease is a severe hemorrhagic fever caused by the Marburg virus.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Marburg virus, transmitted through contact with infected animals or body fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with infected animals, using protective equipment.

diseases.name: Chapare Hemorrhagic Fever
diseases.introduction: Chapare Hemorrhagic Fever is a rare but serious disease caused by the Chapare virus.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Chapare virus, transmitted through contact with infected rodents or body fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with rodents, using protective equipment.

diseases.name: Sudan Virus Disease
diseases.introduction: Sudan Virus Disease is a type of Ebola virus disease causing severe hemorrhagic fever.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Sudan virus, transmitted through contact with infected animals or body fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with infected animals, using protective equipment.

diseases.name: Oropouche Virus Disease
diseases.introduction: Oropouche Virus Disease is transmitted by biting midges and causes febrile illness.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Oropouche virus, transmitted by biting midges.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, pain relief, and hydration.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding bites from midges, using insect repellent.

diseases.name: Human Metapneumovirus
diseases.introduction: Human Metapneumovirus is a respiratory virus causing severe illness in young children and the elderly.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Human Metapneumovirus, spread through respiratory droplets.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, viral culture, and serology.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, oxygen therapy, and antiviral medications.
diseases.prevention: Hand hygiene, avoiding contact with infected individuals.

diseases.name: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever
diseases.introduction: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever is a tick-borne viral disease causing severe hemorrhagic fever.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Crimean-Congo hemorrhagic fever virus, transmitted by tick bites or contact with infected animals.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding tick bites, using protective clothing.

diseases.name: Lassa Fever
diseases.introduction: Lassa Fever is a viral hemorrhagic illness caused by the Lassa virus.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Lassa virus, transmitted through contact with infected rodents or body fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medication (ribavirin), supportive care.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with rodents, maintaining good hygiene.

diseases.name: Nipah Virus Infection
diseases.introduction: Nipah Virus Infection is a zoonotic disease causing severe respiratory and neurological symptoms.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Nipah virus, transmitted through contact with infected animals or body fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, intensive care management.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with infected animals, using protective equipment.

diseases.name: Rift Valley Fever
diseases.introduction: Rift Valley Fever is a viral disease affecting both animals and humans, causing fever and hemorrhagic symptoms.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Rift Valley fever virus, transmitted by mosquito bites or contact with infected animals.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding mosquito bites, using insect repellent.

diseases.name: Hendra Virus Infection
diseases.introduction: Hendra Virus Infection is a zoonotic disease causing severe respiratory and neurological symptoms.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Hendra virus, transmitted through contact with infected horses or body fluids.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, intensive care management.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with infected animals, using protective equipment.

diseases.name: Kyasanur Forest Disease
diseases.introduction: Kyasanur Forest Disease is a tick-borne viral disease causing hemorrhagic fever.
diseases.causes: Caused by the Kyasanur Forest disease virus, transmitted by tick bites.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding tick bites, using protective clothing.

diseases.name: Severe Fever with Thrombocytopenia Syndrome
diseases.introduction: Severe Fever with Thrombocytopenia Syndrome is a tick-borne viral disease causing severe fever and low platelet count.
diseases.causes: Caused by the SFTS virus, transmitted by tick bites.
diseases.diagnosis: PCR tests, ELISA, and virus isolation.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, rehydration, and symptomatic treatment.
diseases.prevention: Avoiding tick bites, using protective clothing.
